name: Marshall Islands
description: The Marshall Islands are a remote island nation in the Micronesia region of the western Pacific Ocean. Comprising 29 atolls and five reef islands, the archipelago is renowned for its stunning coral reefs, rich marine biodiversity, and significant historical ties to nuclear testing. The islands boast a unique blend of traditional Polynesian culture and modern influences, offering visitors a captivating experience.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The political and economic center of the Marshall Islands.
quickFacts.detail: Majuro is the largest city and home to the National Congress and the Presidential Palace.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of the Marshall Islands is relatively small.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides on Majuro and Ebeye atolls.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The Marshall Islands are a small island nation.
quickFacts.detail: The total land area is approximately 181 square kilometers.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency is the United States Dollar.
quickFacts.detail: The Marshall Islands are a U.S. territory and use the USD.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: English is also widely spoken, particularly in government and education.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: The economy is largely dependent on fishing and remittances.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is heavily reliant on the U.S. for financial support.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: The Marshall Islands experience a tropical maritime climate characterized by consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the wet season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is generally sunny and pleasant, with lower humidity levels.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings frequent rainfall and occasional tropical storms.

naturalWonders.name: Bikini Atoll
naturalWonders.description: Bikini Atoll is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its stunning coral reefs and its pivotal role in the history of nuclear testing during the Cold War. The atoll’s ecosystem has remarkably recovered, offering a unique opportunity to witness the resilience of nature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The atoll’s lagoon is a vibrant ecosystem teeming with marine life. The remnants of the nuclear tests are still visible, serving as a stark reminder of the past.  The surrounding waters are exceptionally clear, making it a prime location for diving and snorkeling.
viewingTips: Respect the historical significance of the site.

naturalWonders.name: Rongga Island
naturalWonders.description: Rongga Island is a beautiful reef island known for its pristine beaches, abundant marine life, and traditional Marshallese culture.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island offers a tranquil escape with opportunities for swimming, snorkeling, and exploring the local village. The coral reefs surrounding Rongga are exceptionally diverse, supporting a wide range of fish and invertebrates.
viewingTips: Learn about Marshallese customs and traditions.

ecosystemData.title: Coral Reef Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: The Marshall Islands are home to one of the world’s most extensive and diverse coral reef ecosystems. These reefs provide vital habitat for a vast array of marine species and protect the islands from storm surges.

biodiversityCategories.name: Fish
biodiversityCategories.description: The coral reefs support a remarkable diversity of fish species, including colorful reef fish, sharks, and rays.

statistics.details: Many species are endemic to the region.
Includes reef sharks and hammerhead sharks.

notableSpecies.name: Giant Clam
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the reef ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Grey Reef Shark
notableSpecies.significance: An apex predator maintaining balance in the food chain.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Invertebrates
biodiversityCategories.description: The reefs are teeming with invertebrates, including corals, sea stars, sea urchins, and crustaceans.

statistics.details: Diverse coral forms, including branching, massive, and plate corals.

notableSpecies.name: Giant Hermit Crab
notableSpecies.significance: Plays a role in nutrient cycling.

notableSpecies.name: Crown-of-Thorns Starfish
notableSpecies.significance: Can cause coral damage if populations explode.

activities.title: Island Adventures
activities.description: The Marshall Islands offer a wide range of activities for adventure seekers and nature lovers.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands’ interior and discover stunning viewpoints.

activities.name: Mount Jaluit Hike
activities.description: Hike to the summit of Mount Jaluit, the highest point in the Marshall Islands, for panoramic views.
safety: Be aware of changing weather conditions.

activities.name: Rongga Island Trail
activities.description: A gentle trail around Rongga Island, offering scenic coastal views.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of the Marshall Islands with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Diving
activities.description: Discover underwater caves, shipwrecks, and diverse marine ecosystems.

clothing.winter: Light jacket, long-sleeved shirts, long pants.
clothing.yearRound: Modest clothing is appreciated when visiting villages.

equipment.basic: Sunscreen, insect repellent, flashlight, first-aid kit.
equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle.
